it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen

Class VirtualScreenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.VirtualScreenManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.primesense.nite.HandTracker.NewFrameListener

    public class VirtualScreenManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.primesense.nite.HandTracker.NewFrameListener
    Singleton that manages the virtual screen. It needs to be initialized with a VirtualScreen and a VirtualScreenInitializer. It updates VirtualScreenListeners on each frame with the updated HandData.
    Author:
    giovanni

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize(VirtualScreen vscreen,
                 VirtualScreenInitializer vscreenInit)
        Initializes the VirtualScreen with the given VirtualScreenInitializer
        Parameters:
        vscreen - The VirtualScreen to initialize
        vscreenInit - The VirtualScreenInitializer to use
        Returns:
        true if the initialization was successful, false otherwise

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Returns:
        true if the VirtualScreenManager has been correctly initialized, false otherwise

      • getVirtualScreen

        public VirtualScreen getVirtualScreen()
        Returns:
        the VirtualScreen this manager is using, or null if it hasn't been initialized yet

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Disposes of all resources this manager is using. After this call, the manager will be in its default uninitialized state. It is safe to call again initialize(VirtualScreen, VirtualScreenInitializer) after this call. This method is automatically called in the destructor. It is safe to invoke multiple times.
